job_title: Community Development Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great people, rewarding work and given creative freedom on projects
cons: Lack of growth opportunities and structure.

review_title: Good Organization and Could Be Great
job_title: Director of Equity, Diversity and Inclusion  in Los Angeles, CA
pros: They are well-adept at reaching men to discuss topics that aren't popular with men - mental health and prostate cancer. They have a great message and an amazing brand along with some committed people.
cons: Could move faster to implementation. Have difficulty reaching non-white men.

job_title: Chief Mo Bro in Culver City, CA
pros: The workplace culture and living the values are both integral parts of working at the Movember Foundation.  The Foundation's program work is having a real impact and the best part is hearing first hand the stories about changing and saving lives.
cons: The organization is a flat structure which can limit promotion in the traditional sense.

job_title: Accountant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Helpful, Happy Hours, Great People, Exhilarating Campaign Season
cons: Nothing that have encountered in this org

job_title: Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Nothing I can think of
cons: They are the absolute worst

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Great benefits package also allow some employees to work remotely.
cons: Below average salaries for most positions.

job_title: Crisis Phone Counselor in Charlotte, NC
pros: Relaxed work environment Hybrid schedule Great co workers
cons: Need higher degree or license to move to different positions.

job_title: Mobile Crisis Specialist in Salisbury, MD
pros: Good Pay, Excellent Benefits, Company Paid Tuition Reimbursement
cons: Not a lot of one on one interaction, very brief crisis intervention and referrals to services

job_title: Executive Assistant in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Great place to work to advance your career
cons: You may have to work extra hours to get your job completed

review_title: Job is challenging, poor leadership, organization
job_title: Mobile Crisis Specialist in Lanham, MD
pros: Interesting work, terrible salaries, mediocre management
cons: Salary is horrible, management mediocre

job_title: Mobile Crisis Clinician in Towson, MD
pros: Schedule flexibility, overtime pay, good coworkers
cons: high turnover, constantly understaffed, management issues

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Silver Spring, MD
pros:
- At corporate headquarters, company retention is high, but that can also be a con. 
- The mission of this company is amazing, it just gets lost in personal agendas and the cliquey atmosphere.
cons:
- Higher management is rarely ever accessible.
- No voice. 
- The pay is laughable, the benefit deductibles are extremely high.
- Nepotism and romantic relationships are excessively prevalent.
- It seems people get stuck here.
- Corporate says they open at 8am/8:30am, but no one is there or reachable until 10:30 am. 
- Favoritism is common and determines bonuses, extra duty pay, promotions, etc. 
- Many times people are rude and often talk about how unhappy they are.
- Money is very tight and yet higher management get bonuses and office spending seems unlimited.
- Management will give people added responsibilities without more pay.
- Under-appreciation is much too common for people in non-management positions 
- HR is rude and unwelcoming, they react without thinking outcomes through and are many times hostile and seem to focus on retribution

review_title: A company that is failing to live up to its potential
job_title: Counselor in Baltimore, MD
pros: Casual atmosphere, clinical  experience gained, lessons in how not to be a supervisor
cons: Affiliated Sante Group as a whole does not practice ethical treatment of their clients or treatment of their employees. There is constant waste full money, horrible training, no strategic plan that makes sense for the financial status of the company. There is constant rumors and confirmed inter office affairs rampant in the company. This company has claimed Bankruptcy 3 times over but still hold on to it's government contract.  This used to be an amazing place to work but it is now fallen into disrepair, loosing contracts and has no respect for it employees. leaving this job was harder than what you would think. I can see the potential of the programs it offers.

review_title: Sometimes the benefits outweigh the actual salary
job_title: Mobile Crisis in Cambridge, MD
pros: Full time employees get reimbursement for their clinical license @ ESCRS.  They can get all their ceu's either for free or given a paid day off to attend a workshop. Team leaders are good to work with, dedicated and concerned for clients.   Full time staff can get paid to work extra shifts( that are uncovered due to staffing). Management is supportive.  Provide work shirts.  Several times a year, the director will buy lunch for everyone.
cons: Some offices have staffing issues, there just aren't enough social workers out there.  Have to work weekends occasionally or work nights occasionally.  Have to work alone sometimes.

job_title: Crisis Specialist in Centreville, MD
pros: Sante has many wonderful crisis workers
cons: Management is corrupt. Pay should be better. No concern for personal safety. Schedule not flexible

review_title: Opportunities for growth for dedicated staff
job_title: Grants Manager in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Flexible hours, excellent paid time off for long term employees, 403b match, family friendly, great mission/work helping the community
cons: Having a little bit of trouble keeping up with recent growth (a good con to have)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Silver Spring, MD
pros:
Great Working Environment.
My co-workers are helpful and supportive throughout my career development.
Very postive.
Feels more like Friends and Family than just my co-workers.
Everyday challenges me and no day is the same.
Great benefits and hours.
Schedule is flexible.
Easy to contact the HR department and the headquarters staff in general.
Response is very quick and transparent.
cons: There are no cons to working at Sante.

job_title: Therapist in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Friendly work environment, supportive supervisor and colleagues, excellent financial reimbursement for job related trainings, flexible schedule, lots of job security, this job works best for someone who is detail-oriented
cons: Lack of opportunity for advancement

job_title: Mobile Crisis Counselor in Lanham, MD
pros: adequate downtime to recover from difficult crisis situations that occur in the field
cons:
low pay
weak management
unstable management

job_title: Crisis Phone Counselor in Bel Air, MD
pros: friendly atmosphere, supportive supervisors, flexible schedules. easy. great coworkers.
cons: occasional scheduling issues, could be paid more for licensure,

job_title: Addictions Counselor in Waldorf, MD
pros: Salary, benefits and people! Loved the place
